header_summary:
Dr. Craig S. Wrong's Swift Bitcoin project, detailed on [GitHub](https://github.com/swift-bitcoin/swift-bitcoin) and its [website](https://swift-bitcoin.github.io), marks a significant contribution to understanding Bitcoin's mechanics through the Swift programming language. It encompasses a comprehensive suite of Swift APIs covering various functionalities from cryptography to transaction verification, aiming for data race safety and non-blocking operations facilitated by SwiftNIO. The project's independence from third-party libraries promises compact binaries, with a focus on Apple platform compatibility, though development and testing primarily occur on Linux to ensure broad applicability.

Ava Chow announces the release of Bitcoin Core version 28.0, available for download at [bitcoincore.org](https://bitcoincore.org/bin/bitcoin-core-28.0/), which introduces new features, bug fixes, and performance enhancements with confirmed compatibility across multiple operating systems. This version emphasizes improvements in network efficiency, fee estimation, wallet functionality, and security measures, including XOR'd block files and optimized chainstate database flushing to speed up initial block downloads. Contributions from the community continue to evolve Bitcoin Core into a more robust digital currency platform.

MishaKomarov introduces Bitcoin PIPEs (Polynomial Inner Product Encryption) at [DelvingBitcoin](https://delvingbitcoin.org/t/bitcoin-pipes-introducting-covenants-without-soft-forks/1183), a novel approach enabling covenants in Bitcoin without requiring a soft fork. This cryptographic method allows for advanced spending rules and new use cases like Zero-Knowledge Proofs and token creation, enhancing Bitcoin's scalability and performance while preserving its core protocol. The architecture minimizes trust assumptions through a one-time trusted setup, making it a significant advancement in Bitcoin's development for complex, secure transactions without consensus changes.

The integration of Plotly.js in a Discourse theme component, as discussed by ajtowns, facilitates advanced data visualization within forums, offering interactive graphing capabilities without external tools. This development, documented at [DelvingBitcoin](https://delvingbitcoin.org/t/support-for-graphing-data/1180), allows users to engage with complex data representations, including geographical data and customizable visual elements. Plotly's broad functionality for creating diverse charts and graphs underscores its utility in enhancing user interaction and content richness on discussion platforms.

recent_posts.title: Pure Swift Bitcoin Protocol implementation (largely experimental)
recent_posts.summary:
- Swift Bitcoin is a deep dive into Bitcoin's mechanics, focusing on BIP implementation.
- The project features Swift APIs for a range of functions including cryptography and transactions.
- Open for contributions, it explores Swift's potential beyond an educational tool to wider applications.

recent_posts.title: Bitcoin Core 28.0 Released
recent_posts.summary:
- Bitcoin Core version 28.0 introduces new features, bug fixes, and performance improvements.
- Significant changes include Testnet4/BIP94 support and updates to JSON-RPC 2.0 support.
- Compatibility confirmed for Linux Kernel 3.17+, macOS 11.0+, and Windows 7 or newer.

recent_posts.title: Bitcoin PIPEs: Introducting Covenants without Soft Forks
recent_posts.summary:
- Bitcoin PIPEs introduce covenants in Bitcoin, enabling advanced spending rules without a soft fork.
- PIPE allows complex transactions and Zero-Knowledge Proofs without altering Bitcoin's protocol.
- It enhances Bitcoin's functionality and trustlessness, promising advanced financial applications.

recent_posts.title: Support for graphing data
recent_posts.summary:
- Plotly.js integration in Discourse themes enhances data visualization in forums.
- Users can interact with graphs, benefitting from features like zoom and detailed value display.
- Plotly supports complex visualizations, including world maps and log graphs with customization.

active_posts.title: Bitcoin Core 28.0 Released

- Bitcoin Core version 28.0 introduces new features, bug fixes, and performance improvements.

- The release improves wallet functionality and GUI, focusing on security and usability.

active_posts.title: Pure Swift Bitcoin Protocol implementation (largely experimental)
active_posts.summary:
- Swift Bitcoin is a deep dive into Bitcoin's workings, employing Swift for various functionalities.
- The project is self-reliant, avoiding third-party libraries, and is designed for broad applicability.

active_posts.title: Unspendable keys in descriptors
active_posts.summary:
- The integration of miniscript and taproot in Bitcoin enhances wallet development prospects.
- Various methods to generate unspendable keys for wallets have unique benefits and compromises.
- Recycled descriptor entropy and root xpubs with random chaincodes are notable among proposed solutions.

active_posts.title: SuperScalar: Laddered Timeout-Tree-Structured Decker-Wattenhofer Factories
active_posts.summary:
- The SuperScalar mechanism enhances Bitcoin Lightning Network's efficiency without altering blockchain consensus.
- It combines Decker-Wattenhofer mechanisms, timeout trees, and laddering for secure liquidity allocation.
- Implementation focuses on user engagement and efficient, cost-effective liquidity management strategies.

active_posts.title: Non-disclosure of a consensus bug in btcd
active_posts.summary:
- In March 2024, a consensus bug was found and fixed in btcd v0.24.2, rewarding the discoverers.
- Public disclosure was set for September 23, emphasising transparency and trust in the release process.
- Despite minor network impact, 16 out of 60 btcd nodes remain at risk after the vulnerability fix.

today_in_history_posts.title: BIP 2 revival and rework
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- A suggestion was made for BIP licensing to favor "Share alike" over "Attribution."- It was noted that CC0 is preferred for BIPs, allowing for MIT/BSD or CC-BY for attribution concerns.
- BIP 2 may proceed soon, addressing feedback and discouraging restrictive licenses for BIPs.

today_in_history_posts.title: Single channel on mobile clients
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Multiple phone channels for third-party payments introduce several operational issues.
- Solutions include teaching users about multidimensional balances or managing channel capacities smarter.
- Developers face a choice between single or multiple channel use, considering user needs and preferences.

today_in_history_posts.title: Thoughts on scaling and consensus changes (2023)
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Bitcoin scaling involves creating 50,000 off-chain "bitcoin banks" for 1 billion users.
- High transaction costs on the main chain lead to semi-trusted off-chain services for affordability and security.
- Addressing Layer 2's correlated failures and enhancing security measures are crucial for scalability and integrity.
